In answer to this, leaving the pretext of necessity, which is but a weak and futile plea,1aslr whether they can exculpate themselves from all guilt. For is they are convicted of any fault, the Lord justly reproaches them with their perverseness‚ as the cause of their not having experienced the advantage of his clemency. Let them answer, then, if they can deny that their own perverse will was the cause of their obstinacy. lf they find the source of the evil within themselves, why do they so earnestly inquire after extraneous causes, that they may not appear to have been the authors of their own ruin?
